metadata.title: CVE-2010-5321 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description: Memory leak in drivers/media/video/videobuf-core.c in the videobufsubsystem in the Linux kernel 2.6.x through 4.x allows local users to causea denial of service (memory consumption) by leveraging /dev/video accessfor a series of mmap calls that require new allocations, a differentvulnerability than CVE-2007-6761. NOTE: as of 2016-06-18, this affects only11 drivers that have not been updated to use videobuf2 instead of videobuf.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
